byline.original: By JACEY FORTIN and JOSH KRON

abstract: South Sudan's fifth anniversary of its independence is marred by armed clashes between factions supporting Pres Salva Kiir and Vice Pres Riek Machar; at least 150 people have been killed in recent violence centered around capital Juba.

headline.print_headline: New Wave of Violence Ripples Across South Sudan’s Capital
headline.main: Juba Gripped by Renewed Violence as Factions Clash in South Sudan

keywords.value: War Crimes, Genocide and Crimes Against Humanity
keywords.name: subject

keywords.value: United States Defense and Military Forces
keywords.name: subject

snippet: Armed battles and waves of gunfire spread across the capital a day after the fifth anniversary of the nation’s independence....
lead_paragraph: Armed battles and waves of gunfire spread across the capital a day after the fifth anniversary of the nation’s independence.
